Liver cancer is a disease in which malignant (cancer) cells form in the tissues of the liver. Bronchitis is inflammation of the airways that carry air to your lungs, or bronchi. There are two main types of bronchitis: acute and chronic. Acute bronchitis is a common illness that usually lasts several days. It can be caused by a virus or bacteria and often begins after an upper respiratory tract infection such as a cold. Symptoms include coughing, wheezing and shortness of breath. Chronic bronchitis is a long-term condition that is caused by exposure to lung irritants. Symptoms include a productive cough for at least three months a year for two consecutive years.
